title: 113_hr4743
content: The Act may be cited as the "Bonus Depreciation Extension Act of 2014" and extends bonus depreciation. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to change dates for bonus depreciation and accelerate AMT credits. For any taxable year, certain provisions apply: (i) certain paragraphs do not apply, (ii) straight-line depreciation method must be used for qualified property, and (iii) the limitation under section 53(c) is increased by the bonus depreciation amount determined for that year. The bonus depreciation amount for a taxable year is calculated based on specific criteria. The bonus depreciation amount for any taxable year is 20 percent of the excess of the aggregate depreciation allowed for qualified property placed in service by the taxpayer during that year under specific conditions. The bonus depreciation amount for any taxable year is limited to 50 percent of the minimum tax credit under section 53(b) for the first taxable year ending after December 31, 2013. The bonus depreciation amount is limited to 50 percent of the minimum tax credit under section 53(b) for the first taxable year ending after December 31, 2013. All corporations treated as a single employer under section 52(a) are treated as 1 taxpayer for this purpose. The paragraph discusses the election and refundable credit rules for corporations applying for certain tax credits. An election under this paragraph can only be revoked with the Secretary's consent. In partnerships with electing partners, specific rules apply. In partnerships, corporations can make an election for tax purposes, affecting their distributive share and depreciation method for qualified property. Certain rules apply for partnerships with electing partners. In partnerships where over 50% of capital and profits are owned by one corporation, each partner calculates bonus depreciation based on their share of partnership amounts. The text discusses amendments to the tax code related to passenger aircraft and changes in effective dates for certain provisions. Amendments to the tax code regarding effective dates for certain provisions, including changes to dates for property placed in service and the election to accelerate AMT credits in lieu of bonus depreciation. The amendment applies to taxable years ending after December 31, 2013, with a transitional rule for years beginning before January 1, 2014. The bonus depreciation amount is determined based on property placed in service before January 1, 2014. The bonus depreciation amount for taxable years ending after December 31, 2013, is calculated by a specific formula that considers the number of days in the taxable year before January 1, 2014. This calculation is adjusted for property placed in service after January 1, 2014. The bonus depreciation amount for taxable years ending after December 31, 2013, is calculated by a specific formula that considers the number of days in the taxable year before January 1, 2014. This calculation is adjusted for property placed in service after December 31, 2013. The amendment made by subsection (e) shall take effect as if included in the provision of the American Taxpayer Relief Act of 2012 to which it relates.
